intro: Acustelma grandidieri, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Acustelma grandidieri is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in the flora of Madagascar.
